      • printDebugMessage

        public void printDebugMessage(java.lang.String str)
        Instead of printing messages to the console using System.out.printl(), use this method. That way, printing can be turned on/off without your having to comment out your debug printing lines
        Parameters:
        str - The String to write to the console when DEBUG_MODE is turned on

      • chooseMove

        public abstract Location chooseMove(int[][] idArray)
        Override this method and put your game logic here. To look at the board, you can access the 'board' variable inherited from Player.
        Overrides:
        chooseMove in class Player
        Returns:
        The Location your player will place a piece next
